WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;m not entirely sure since I #8217;ve only seen the Live a couple of times. I think the usual actor for Race stands with the Brooklyn Newsies in #8220;Brooklyn #8217;s here #8221;. This is probably just to fill it but you know how fandoms work. Also, Race touches spot in some screen? Like when Jack is betraying them? Not 100%

Only if you believe in looooooveeee~ Wrong fandom. But I think like this; Fiyero is a prince. He is obviously handsome, rich and kind of a bad boy. It is shown in #8220;Dancing through life #8221; how BASICALLY everyone swoons over him as soon as he walks in. Expecting him to be this fun, carefree idiot. But we realise later, thanks to Elphaba that he actually is just kind of depressed. So I don #8217;t think Fiyero chose Elphaba because #8220;WoAh i tHinK I LovE hEr??? Maybe??? #8221; I think he noticed how Elphaba was the only one/one of the first people to actually CARE about him and see through him. And he did know Elphaba was innocent. So I think, even though wealth and privelege would give a fantastic life, would it really be as fulfilling without someone to understand you really? To be sure that they love you for you and not your looks? To do the right thing? But this is just my thoughts.
I just brought them home like 6 hours ago so I #8217;m not sure if it #8217;s a habit she #8217;ll keep but she #8217;s done it to all dumps she has laid so far.

I guess so. I have two rats but the other one is more used to me since I visited it frequently at the Zoo. The other just came from the breeder so she #8217;s much more hesitant. Ever since she got home she #8217;s been hiding in one of the igloos and only eats when I look away. The other pretty much always stays outside and jumps up on my hand whenever she can. Another thing that worries me is that they both sleep a LOT. And they both do it in separate corners, one level away from eachother. Since I #8217;ve never had rats I #8217;m not sure if this behavior is normal or not and the internet hasn #8217;t been much help this far.

They haven #8217;t squabbled anything what I can see. I tried putting them both on the same level and they bundled up in a pile immediately. One of them (Nessa) always stands over my other (Letchie) and I #8217;m not sure if Letchie is fine with that since she #8217;s rather shy usually. They have a huge cage to be in and I #8217;ve taken them both out into a secure but open area where they could free roam but Letchie wants to stay in her corner on the highest level and if I try to put her elsewhere she climbs right back up. Nessa stays wherever I put her and doesn #8217;t go anywhere even though there are paths and toys all around her.
Have a virtual hug from Sweden!

WRITING.TITLE: Mother drops her kid off at our house to go on an unannounced vacation - in another country.
WRITING.TEXT: Tl;dr in the end This all went down when I was still in middle school so it #8217;s a bit blurry. I spent most breaks usually following my older brother around, doing whatever he did. That way I got to meet many of his friends, including his then best friend Fred. Even when my brother wasn #8217;t in school, Fred would play with me instead of his own classmates. He treated me like his own little sister and was overall a nice kid. Fred #8217;s mother would ask to leave Fred with us while she made some errands every now and then. It usually didn #8217;t last longer than a few hours so my parents didn #8217;t mind, but then she began just dropping him off and leaving without a word. It became a problem for when we had plans those days and as this went on for a while, we couldn #8217;t really do stuff on our free time anymore because #8220;What if Fred comes? #8221; My mother liked Fred but she was concerned of course. She tried contacting Fred #8217;s mom but she had stopped responding out of nowhere. She dropped him off almost daily now but never responded to any calls from my parents. We didn #8217;t know where Fred lived and every time he was asked about his mother he would be quiet. My mom figured that maybe his mother had a few problems of her own she needed to handle for a while so she didn #8217;t mind having him. She didn #8217;t stop trying to reach Fred #8217;s family (even distant relatives) but she tried not to let it bother us kids. But then one time when Fred #8217;s mother dropped him off, she didn #8217;t come back. My mother got more stressed as the days went on without her showing up and it didn #8217;t go unnoticed by me and my brother. We took care of him naturally but as we had no clue when or IF his mother was coming back, my parents tried harder than ever to get in touch with people - From contacting our school to stalking Fred #8217;s mothers social media in an attempt to find anything. And then after two WEEKS she came to pick him up again. This time my mother stepped in front of the car and refused to move until Fred #8217;s mother stepped out and talked to her. It was revealed that she had dropped him off to go on a vacation In the neighbouring country. My mother couldn #8217;t trust Fred #8217;s mother anymore, of course, and told her that although he was allowed to play with us, she wouldn #8217;t babysit him. So Fred #8217;s mother stopped dropping him off all together. Instead she would pass by the school and talk to me and my brother during breaks. She went as far as telling us, a pair of children, how she thought our mother was irresponsible and rude. Fred was fine for a while but then he also began talking about our mother the same way, probably influenced by his own mother. My brother, bold as he is, told Fred several times how he didn #8217;t like what he was saying and after a while told him to stay away from us all together since he didn #8217;t really change his ways. Because I was more shy and manipulative, heinstead went on to try talking with me when my brother wasn #8217;t around, He would randomly come and stand behind me while I was swinging to push me or something and then walk away as soon as he saw my brother approaching. It was creepy. After that I don #8217;t know what happened but Fred ended up switching schools. We laugh about it today but I still wonder what happened to him. Tl:dr In middle school my friend #8217;s mother dropped her kid off at our house for two weeks without a notice to go on a vacation in the neighbouring country. After that she and the kid talks badly about my mother in front of me on school breaks.
Holy damn you #8217;re beautiful.

It is hard to get pictures of her since she #8217;s the more energetic one and when she sleeps it #8217;s usually hidden or under her older sister. The zoo where we got her are pretty bad at rats it seems and we aren #8217;t too certain of her age, but we got her when she was just a few weeks old. I #8217;d bet she #8217;s about three months old or so?
In my school it #8217;d be weirder to call teachers by their surnames. We even call the principal by her first name.

Coming from a Christian family, I #8217;ve always been told that god doesn #8217;t have control over what happens. God isn #8217;t a person or an object. God has no direct power on earth. God is just a relief, a person who loves you when nobody else does and listens when no one else will. Someone who can hear your rants and cries and not judge you. But then again, the information and beliefs gets very thrown around when it comes to different churches, Basically, god has no control over who wins the lottery or who gets abused. He can only be there for you to help you get through it.

My bible is not English so this is a rough translation by me but the whole quote should go something like this; #8220;Then he said: #8220;But now shall you who have a penny pouch take it with you, and as well the bag, and the one who is without money shall sell his cape and buy a sword. #8221;

Oh no, you weren #8217;t offensive at all! I just wanted to help out. Plus reading the bible is a matter of perspective and every quote can be taken differently by different people. It is also filled with metaphors and laws that just can #8217;t be followed today because they #8217;re so outdated. What I #8217;m saying is, you shouldn #8217;t take the quotes too seriously. No matter how Christian you are.
I think it #8217;s Furry, actually. Those suits are quite convincing.
We weren #8217;t even allowed to use grills or campfire for a while during the heat wave and the radios constantly updated on the many Forrest fires all around the country. I #8217;m from Sweden.
Pfft yeah, RIGHT. and soon you #8217;re going to tell me that five foot tall, neon coloured wolves standing on two legs with a sense of human fashion aren #8217;t even real.

As a Christian I #8217;ve always learned that god can #8217;t control anyone. That you #8217;re in charge of your own deeds and misdeeds in your own life. He is everything you want him to be. He can be the scapegoat, the ally or the nonpartial voice. He can #8217;t save you from abuse but he will help you get through it. In my church we don #8217;t praise god because he is our dictator or because we necessarily have to - we do it as thanks.
If you honestly think that I am gonna cross an entire ocean, one continent and probably thousands of kilometres just to pet some baby rats then you #8217;re absolutely right.
Now he exists... Only in my mind.
It #8217;s a bird! No, it #8217;s a plane! No... It #8217;s RATWOMAN!!
I didn #8217;t know about this Tetris update?

Zara Larsson. Living in Sweden, it was pretty exhausting to see everyone talking about Zara Larsson, the swede who #8217;s music is known by th entire world. In difference to ABBA and other Swedish legends, I just viewed her as the typical narcissistic pop star who only lived on Autotune and good looks. Nothing else. She #8217;s blonde, wears flashy clothes and keeps mentioning her love life. Then when I was in the car with my dad, he put on a pod about her. I knew dad had no idea who she was and only put it on cause he thought I liked her but it was sweet of him so I listened. Turned out she had been singing with this much power ever since she was little. Her voice is genuine. And despite her incredible talent, she speaks openly about feminism and doesn #8217;t filter her opinions just for the fans sake. I really judged the book by its cover on this one.

Well he is very impulsive and well #8220;brainless #8221; but I think Elphaba could help a lot on that part. Other than that he is shown to be very sympathetic and caring. In the musical he would give up hits place as captain of the guard and be a wanted criminal just to spend one night with the woman he loved so I doubt anything would go before his children. He wouldn #8217;t be a perfect dad but he wouldn #8217;t be a bad one is what I #8217;m saying. Then there #8217;s the fact that he #8217;s a scarecrow so him having children isn #8217;t too possible anyways. I, quite obviously, have only watched the musical. I can #8217;t talk for book Fiyero,
Just 6 hours? I won #8217;t get done with that shit for another couple of years or so!
Woah there, easy with the nudes #128514;

WRITING.TITLE: My mom shakes me and screams at me after panic attack caused by suicide attempt.
WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;ve been diagnosed with anxiety since three years back and my mom knows it. She knows I will have panic attacks. It #8217;s just that since three years ago it has gotten worse. And my panic attacks are instead of just shaking and screaming to actually trying to end my life. I #8217;m way too scared to actually do it I think. But I #8217;ve attempted to. I #8217;ve tried knives, fire, drowning and just today I tried hitting my head in my bathtub, chairs and more. I just feel so empty and while I might not want death, I want some sort of break or a stop. Everything is going to fast and I don #8217;t even have my own body in control anymore. Today my brother found me #8220;sleeping #8221; on the bathroom floor. I was awake but I couldn #8217;t move or talk, I didn #8217;t feel like I had the physical power to do anything no matter how much I actually wanted to. He called for my mom and once she came up she started shaking my body, even when I had proved to be awake and she screamed at me stuff like #8220;Sit up! You know you can. #8221; #8220;Are you going to let the anxiety take over? #8221; #8220;You sit up now. #8221; #8220;You don #8217;t have epilepsy I know you can do it #8221; and other I don #8217;t think she knows about my suicidal thoughts. She knows I #8217;ve made cuts but when I told her she took away everything sharp in my room and now she daily has to check if I have done more. I #8217;ve also tried telling her that her touching me and screaming at me makes me more tense but she insists it #8217;s the only way for me to get out of the attacks. To force myself to ignore it and think happy thoughts but it doesn #8217;t work I take meds daily and nightly and I have therapy sessions. I don #8217;t know what else there is for me to do at this point. It won #8217;t stop it hasn #8217;t for three years and I get more scared. Sorry for bad English
Same here! As I can #8217;t come with actual good advice, the few set of art skills I have might do. If I #8217;m not too late, I #8217;d love to make one as well!

This school has a specific program which doesn #8217;t exist anywhere closer to me. The school allows people from all around the country and I #8217;m legally allowed to stay wherever and however I want since I am 15. My parents would still be my legal guardians though until I #8217;m 18 Yeah I can always move back home if needed so that #8217;s a plus! I #8217;m the type of person who #8217;d rather have everything planned out in beforehand though.
Why Is Every First Letter Of A Word Capitalized? This hurt my soul
My mom won #8217;t let me WATEM. Can I AMAP instead?

In my country school is free, we get free lunch and as a student I #8217;ll get about 200$ weekly by the government to pay off loans and other necessities. Students get a lot of advantages here so while Finance definetely is important, it isn #8217;t much of a problem right now. Health, lodging and predators is what worries me the most. The city is naturally crowded since it #8217;s a capital so I would most likely need to get a roomie of some sort, otherwise it will be nearly impossible to get a place for my own which is something we haven #8217;t figured out yet. I #8217;m also very dependent on my parents to get me out of my panic attacks and as they can #8217;t really move with me I don #8217;t know about that either. My country is also quite #8220;famous #8221; for how many girls get targeted by predators. I #8217;m absolutely frightened because of that. It has always been a goal of mine to attend this school though. I have done plenty of visits and it #8217;s now confirmed that if I can find a way to get to it each morning, I will be able to attend. It #8217;s an extremely hard decision.
Thank you so much. Your comments made me more positive about the situation. It helped
Picture me listening to talks about flirty winks and batting eyelashes... Now picture 8 year old me blinking with both my eyes furiously at my male classmates.
Failed isn #8217;t capitalised though. #8220;failed #8221;
Together we would #8217;ve been that one part of the class that always were in their own bubble because no one else wanted to be with us.
That should be the subreddit for words that don #8217;t mean anything but people pretend it does for the sake of the meme/confusion of others.

My self harm is connected to my panic attacks. Even when there #8217;s nothing #8220;bothering #8221; me I will start shaking, crying and I just have to get as far away from people as I can. I usually run to a bathroom and lock myself in. More and more control I will loose. I go from slightly shaking to jumping uncontrollably, crying to screaming etc. Etc. I am fully mentally aware when this happens but it feels as if I can #8217;t control anything in my entire body and what makes it worse is that I never know WHY it happens. Self harm to me is sort of giving myself a reason and something to control over. If I hurt, it is because I #8217;m hurting myself. Drawing blood isn #8217;t my inner anxiety, it is all me. Harming myself shows. I #8217;m bleeding, I #8217;m in pain. It #8217;s okay for me to feel sad then. I #8217;m not just panicking for no reason, I #8217;m obviously physically hurting. If I can #8217;t find any sharp objects I will punch myself, run into hard objects, claw with my nails over my skin, bite etc. I need the pain to have a reason and to have something to fix. When I take a piece of paper and wipe away the blood I can calm down. I fixed the pain.
